benchmark_details.name: Diverse Tweet Corpus of English Varieties
benchmark_details.overview: The paper curates a dataset of tweets from countries with high proportions of underserved English variety speakers, aiming to address bias in natural language processing (NLP) tools by providing diverse examples of English varieties.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To address the issue of bias caused by unrepresentative data in NLP by providing a corpus that captures a range of English varieties.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The corpus may be skewed towards more privileged populations, and does not fully represent the linguistic diversity of English-speaking communities.

data.source: Collected tweets from Twitter using a geo-tagged data collection approach
data.annotation: Annotated by individuals fluent in regionally-dominant varieties of English

methodology.calculation: Calculated using percent agreement and Cohen’s Kappa coefficient
methodology.interpretation: A Kappa value above 0.8 indicates substantial agreement among annotators.
methodology.validation: Inter-annotator agreement was assessed with a Kappa coefficient of 0.69.
